question.title: Pragmatic Way of Separating KeyedProcessFunction Business Logic in Flink
question.body:
I hope this isn't too out of scope for StackOverflow.

I'm building out an application that keys events to a KeyedProcessFunction. As one would imagine for any complex system, I'm looking for ways split up the business logic. However, most of the business logic requires Context, Collector, ValueState, etc., which are all keyed.

I took the route of splitting things up into static classes while passing everything I need in the parameters:

For example:

    private static void closeSession(
            @NonNull final ValueState<Session> session,
            @NonNull final ValueState<SnapshotHistory> snapshotHistory,
            @NonNull final MapState<Long, List<ScheduledAction>> scheduledActions,
            @NonNull final OnTimerContext context) throws Exception {
        log.info("{} Closing session", Instant.now());
        // do stuff
    }

Is this the canonical Flink way to split up keyed business logic?

I guess I could also put the state in a wrapper class (SessionState) or something so that I only have to pass one parameter instead of the great list of states.
